channel.title: Saving game
channel.description:
Ok, i am starting over, i used to use a testscape source that i stripped down but i recently found a nice basic source, that is baiscally all i tried to do with my testscape source. So, i am trying to add auto save and inactive kicker but i cannot figure out how to save, i think it is something like this [code] PlayerSave tempSave = new PlayerSave(Player.Player(playerId)); [/code] but it says [code] client.java:58: cannot find symbol symbol : method Player(int) location: class Player PlayerSave tempSave = new PlayerSave(Player.Player(playerId)); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . . [/code] but yea, in the player.java file, it has this [code] public Player(int _playerId) { playerId = _playerId; //playerName = "player"+playerId; playerRights = 0; //pelaajantila .... .... .... [/code]
I am assuming this is easy enough and you dont need much else. So thanks in advanced.

item.title: Saving game
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Ok, i am starting over, i used to use a testscape source that i stripped down but i recently found a nice basic source, that is baiscally all i tried to do with my testscape source. So, i am trying to add auto save and inactive kicker but i cannot figure out how to save, i think it is something like this

PlayerSave tempSave = new PlayerSave(Player.Player(playerId));

but it says

client.java:58: cannot find symbol
symbol  : method Player(int)
location: class Player
PlayerSave tempSave = new PlayerSave(Player.Player(playerId));
                                           ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

but yea, in the player.java file, it has this

	public Player(int _playerId) {
		playerId = _playerId;
		//playerName = "player"+playerId;
		playerRights = 0; //pelaajantila
....
....
....

I am assuming this is easy enough and you dont need much else. So thanks in advanced.

Read full topic
